item.title: S. 1433, Thomas P. O'Hara Public Land Career Opportunity Act of 2007
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on January 30, 2008

item.title: S. 1433, Thomas P. O'Hara Public Land Career Opportunity Act of 2007
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on January 30, 2008

summary.text: Thomas P. O'Hara Public Land Career Opportunity Act of 2007 - Amends the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act to provide competitive status to certain permanent federal employees in Alaska after: (1) if the appointment is full-time, the completion of two years of competitive and satisfactory full time service; or (2) if the appointment is less than full time, the period that is equivalent to two years of competitive and satisfactory full time service.

bill.title: Thomas P. O'Hara Public Land Career Opportunity Act of 2007

item.title: Thomas P. O'Hara Public Land Career Opportunity Act of 2007
A bill to amend the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act to provide competitive status to certain Federal employees in the State of Alaska.
Thomas P. O'Hara Public Land Career Opportunity Act of 2007

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 647.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
